name: Mixed Bag 37 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is a book by Anne Lindbergh?
questions.explanation:
'North To The Orient'.

	It was written in 1935. She was the wife of aviator Charles Lindbergh.

Christy Mathewson.

	In his 17-year career he won 373 games for a .664 percentage.

questions.text: Which movie star made her film debut in 'A Double Life'?
questions.explanation:
Shelley Winters.

	That movie was released in 1947. She married Italian actor Vittorio Gassman.

questions.text: Who wrote the line "'Tis better to have loved and lost, then never to have loved at all"?
questions.explanation:
Tennyson.

	Tennyson was an English poet born in 1809. One of his more famous works was 'Ulysses'.

questions.text: Which of the following countries remained neutral throughout World War 1?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	The United States entered the war on April 6, 1917 when it declared war on Germany.

France.

	The first one was built in 1935.

questions.text: Which of the following did Dorothy meet first in the 'Wizard Of Oz'?
questions.explanation:
Scarecrow.

	On her trip down the yellow brick road.

questions.text: What state's license plates were on the Blues Brothers Bluesmobile?
questions.explanation:
Illinois.

	Some well known names in the movie were Cab Caloway, James Brown, John Candy, Ray Charles, and Aretha Franklin.

questions.text: How old was Chopin when he gave his first concert?
questions.explanation:
8.

	Chopin was a Polish composer. He started playing the piano at the age of four and gave a private concert at age eight in Warsaw.

questions.text: Who in Roman mythology was Cupid's mother?
questions.explanation:
Venus.

	Venus was the goddess of love. Aphrodite was the Greek counterpart.
